alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 12:27AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 215 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 AM MST, Thunderstorms earlier this evening dropped between a half an inch and an inch of rainfall near the headwaters of the Sacramento Wash and across far western Golden Valley. Thunderstorm activity has since waned but elevated runoff will remain possible across the western edges of Golden Valley through 215 am. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Golden Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
